entities.name: Japanese
entities.description: The Japanese are an ethnic group native to Japan, known for their rich cultural heritage and contributions to various fields including art, technology, and mathematics.

entities.description: Robotics is the study and design of robots.

entities.name: shapes
entities.description: Shapes refer to the various forms and outlines that can be created using lines and curves, which are fundamental elements in geometry.

attributes.Purpose: To solve problems and perform tasks efficiently

entities.name: DEPLOYABLE SOLAR PANELS
entities.description: Deployable solar panels are engineering applications that use origami principles to create structures that can be folded and unfolded with ease

entities.name: MEDICAL DEVICES
entities.description: Medical devices are applications of origami principles in engineering, designed to be compact and deployable for medical use

entities.name: visually appealing models
entities.description: Attractive representations used for visual appeal.

entities.name: ENGINEERING
entities.description: Engineering is a field that has applied origami-inspired principles to develop innovative structures, such as deployable solar panels and medical devices

entities.name: paper's edges
entities.description: The paper's edges refer to the linear boundaries where two surfaces of the paper meet, forming a one-dimensional geometric structure.

entities.name: repetitions
entities.description: The use of identical elements repeated in a systematic way to create complexity and balance.

entities.name: science
entities.description: Science is a systematic and logical approach to discovering how the world works. It encompasses various disciplines such as physics, chemistry, biology, and more.

attributes.Interdisciplinary Nature: Combines art, mathematics, engineering, and technology
attributes.Innovative Applications: Contributes to advancements in various fields such as origami, computer science, engineering, architecture, and material science

entities.name: symmetrical folds
entities.description: Symmetrical folds are precise creases made along lines of symmetry, ensuring both sides of the paper mirror each other perfectly.

entities.name: Scaling Designs
entities.description: Scaling designs involves adjusting the size of an origami model while maintaining its structural integrity.

entities.name: enthusiasts
entities.description: Enthusiasts are individuals who have a strong interest and passion for origami, often engaging in the creation of intricate designs with precision and accuracy.

entities.name: science and engineering
entities.description: Science and engineering are interdisciplinary fields that apply scientific theories and principles of mathematics, physics, and materials science to design, develop, and create solutions for practical problems.

entities.name: Stability and Balance
entities.description: The structural quality of origami models is ensured by the application of mathematical principles.

entities.name: graph theory
entities.description: Graph Theory studies properties of graphs, which are mathematical structures used to model pairwise relations between objects.

entities.name: symmetry
entities.description: Symmetry refers to balance and harmony of shapes and patterns.

entities.name: design complexity
entities.description: Design complexity refers to the intricacy and detail of an origami design.

entities.name: MATERIAL SCIENCE
entities.description: Material science is a field that has explored the use of origami principles to develop new materials and structures

entities.name: structurally sound models
entities.description: Structurally sound models are creations that are both aesthetically pleasing and physically stable.

entities.name: Angles and Lengths of Folds
entities.description: The angles and lengths of folds are crucial for creating symmetrical and aesthetically pleasing designs.

entities.name: Beauty
entities.description: The aesthetic quality of origami creations is enhanced by the application of mathematical principles.

entities.name: vertices
entities.description: Vertices are the corners where edges of a polygon meet.

entities.name: computational geometry
entities.description: Computational geometry is a branch of mathematics that deals with algorithms for solving geometric problems involving shapes, sizes, positions and relative distances of planar or spatial objects.

entities.name: ratio
entities.description: A ratio is a comparison of two quantities, often expressed as a fraction or with a colon.

entities.name: folds
entities.description: A method of altering paper's shape through precise creasing.

entities.name: Engineers and Designers

entities.name: three-dimensional structures
entities.description: Three-dimensional structures are complex shapes formed by folding paper into various configurations.

entities.name: ARCHITECTURE
